DataElement.preferredName: FACT-Cognitive Questionnaire Other Speak Score Frequency 5 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric response to a questionnaire item asking if an individual has had other people notice his/her trouble thinking clearly.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-Cognitive Questionnaire Other Speak Frequency Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cognitive; of or being or relating to or involving cognition._A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._To communicate using verbal language._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cognitive; of or being or relating to or involving cognition.:A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.

Concepts.definition: Of or being or relating to or involving cognition.

A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.

A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
